text: Is there an easier way to break out of nested loops than throwing an exception?
(In Perl, you can give labels to each loop and at least continue an outer loop.

code:
for x in range(10):
    for y in range(10):
        print x*y
        if x*y > 50:
            "break both loops"

text: I.e., is there a nicer way than:

code:
class BreakIt(Exception): pass

try:
    for x in range(10):
        for y in range(10):
            print x*y
            if x*y > 50:
                raise BreakIt
except BreakIt:
    pass
